Speaker: NA
Title: Unknown
text: House of Representatives. Wednesday, 11 September, 1929. Mr SPEAKER ' (Hon. Sir Littleton Groom) took the chair at' 3 p.m., and read prayers. ADJOURNMENT, POSITION OF THE GOVERNMENT.

Speaker: Mr BEUCE
Title: Unknown
text: Flinders-Prime Minister and Minister for - External' Affairs) [3.1] -(B y leave.)--Las t night, subsequent to, and in consequence of, the rote that was taken in conunittee on. the Maritime Industries Bill, I stated that the Government desired time to consider its position, and moved the adjourmnent of the House. The Government, having considered its position, I , this morning, had an interview with His Excellency the Governor General, at which I tendered to him certain advice. His Excellency is now considering that advice; consequently, - there is no further statement which I can make at the. moment. I , therefore, move That the House do now adjourn. Question resolved in the affirmative. .House adjourned at 3.2 p.m.
